page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content:
The town of Bsildon is divided up into many Neighbourhood Areas. Each of the se areas has a Secondary School, a Junior School and an Infants School.
Most of the children stay within the neighbourhood for all there schooling, but some choose to go elsewhere.
Basildon was full of children once, but now most of them have left school and are at work. This means that many less children are at school in the town, and most schools have only half the number of children they had 10 years ago. Many schools are closing, and the Infant and Junior schools are combining into one school. The old buildings are being used for other purposes.
